content: **kõuvõ** is a versatile piece that can be worn both as a headband and a hat the piece is knit in the round with a narrow folded edge after casting off a number of stitches the leaf-like flap is knit flat **kõuvõ** means birch in livonian an endangered language once spoken by the livonian people in the territory of modern-day latvia and estonia **sizes available ** child adult small adult medium adult large finished length of cowl portion 18 22 22 22 cm/ 7 8¾ 8¾ 8¾ inches finished circumference stretched approx 40 50 58 64 cm/ 16 20 22¾ 24¾ inches the sample was knit in the size adult medium **gauge ** 20 sts x 19 row = 5x5 cm/ 2x2 inches in 2x2 rib unstretched **yarn ** fingering weight yarn plus approx 10% buffer 110 172 205 232 m/120 188 224 254 yds/27 42 50 57 g in case you don t have a full skein and wish to maximise the length of the tubular portion yarn amounts needed for the leaf flap only are provided in the pattern photography by arturs bogdanovs 1 1 https //www instagram com/arturs3111/
